reviewText: This was a gift for my other husband.  He's making us things from it all the time and we love the food.  Directions are simple, easy to read and interpret, and fun to make.  We all love different kinds of cuisine and Raichlen provides recipes from everywhere along the barbecue trail as he calls it. Get it and just open a page.  Have at it.  You'll love the food and it has provided us with an insight into the culture that produced it. It's all about broadening horizons.  Yum!!

This is a very nice spreader.  It feels very solid and the pneumatic tires give it great maneuverability and handling over bumps.  The control arm is solid metal, not a cable, which gives you precise control and will last a long time.  The settings take some experimentation with your various products to get it right, but that is true of any spreader.  It has good distribution... probably flings material a little farther on the right side than the left, but it is far more even than my crappy Edgeguard ever was.

The metal base with the hose attachments is very poorly designed and made. As the previous reviewer pointed out, it leaks badly and just pops off. There is no way to fix or tighten this junction and when the plastic wears a bit the hose just falls off and sprinkler is useless.AVOID ANY GILMOUR Sprinklers with this spike base. The sprinkler heads themselves work fairly well.

For the most part this works pretty good. I bought the John Deere and this one, they both work the same. This is the first time I am waterin my lawn, so to me it seems like they use a lot of water, especially in narrow areas. They are better made for large areas, for narrow corridors, use some other system.

This hose is supposed to be flexible.  Its hard, heavy and unwieldy.  I don't know if it kinks or not, because I could tell, as soon as I removed it from the box, that I would have to return it.  If you want a lightweight, soft hose (and I know they exist because I have one), do not buy this thing.

This tool works very well for cutting brush and woody stemmed weeds up to about 2". It will work for larger brush and small trees with multiple swings but I find it easier to use a bow saw for the occasional larger plants I encounter. Note that if you need to cut a lot of larger brush a brush hook would be better than this ditch bank blade as the brush hook blade is thicker and heavier.The tool needs to be sharpened right out of the package to perform best. This removes the paint and any nicks and burrs from the factory grinding as well shipping and handling nicks. I resharpen the blades and spray them with WD-40 after each use so it remains rust free and is ready to go for the next session of cutting brush. Also, I suggest installing either lock washers or nyloc nuts on the bolts to keep them tight in use. Even with that, check them after each use to make sure they are tight--it seems that initially the ash handle compresses a bit and the metal side plates need time to seat fully into the ash.This tool has been a huge improvement over my large lopping shears and machette for clearing brush on a new rail trail.Great tool if used appropriately. Per the package it can also be used to ward off zombies and the undead but I've not had that need to date.

This product is a typical, yet usable, B&D design. The handle-mounted power cord lock is somewhat difficult to use, but works fairly well after the cord is "locked" into a type of holder that could be improved. The product does what it is intended to do, no more, no less.  It is a powerful vacuum and works very well with high amounts of dry leaf material.  The attached bagger is somewhat cumbersome to use and empty, produces copious amounts of leaf-dust, but overall, this product works quite well in vacuuming lots of leaf and yard material.

I was excited to ditch my $1.99, two-prong corn holders for this corkscrew design but regret it. The corkscrew design twists into the end of the corn. I thought this was a genius idea but the problem is that the prong continues to twist when in the corn. Since it doesn't have a second prong to prevent the pivoting, the corn will flip and slip all around the prong, which is super annoying when trying to butter and eat. The storage case and grips are nice but I think the design itself is problematic. I'll be ditching these and going back to a two-prong approach.
summary: Seems Like Good Idea But Problematic

reviewText: I purchased the Leaf Hog last year and was very impressed with it.  It helped reduce the time to take care of leaves from about 80 hours of work to about 35 hours and my back didn't hurt nearly as much last year.  This year I tried out the Leaf Collection system as much of the time I spent last year was dumping out the leaf collection bag to mulch more until the garbage can was full.  On this go around I had 4 - 55 gallon garbage cans and started mulching the big piles I had.  I would just mulch until a can was full, move the fabric over to the next can and continue.  This sped up my time to finishing in under 20 hours this year.I would highly recommend it if you need to mulch more than a single bag full.  It saved a ton of time for me and I have no doubt it can do the same for you.

Never used a manual lawnmower. Need to adjust heigth of back roller. If you have a small area then its fine. You will need a trimmer though for edges and difficult areas. May have to go over the area twice to make the cut even

Good price. Good product. I had read some poor reviews of competitive products before purchasing this one, so I was a little concerned. But the Flowtron turned out to be exactly what I was looking for.

I have owned the Flowtron BK-15D for about nine months now. I have it hanging at the corner ceiling of my room. The power plug of the bug lamp is connected to a 24 hour digital programmable timer (Intermatic DT121) set to automatically turn on the bug lamp at night, then turn off in the morning. Underneath the bug lamp is a litter tray with a mixture of baking soda and beach sand. I have had no problems with the bug lamp. There are times when I am woken up from sleep because of bugs being zapped, but after a while, you can get used to that zapping sound. Last year, prior to owning the bug lamp, I have had spider bites, gnat infestations, wandering moths, and mosquitoes in my room. With the Flowtron BK-15D, my room and bed is now bug-free. No more expenses toward bug sprays and rash ointments. As far as cleaning and maintaining the bug lamp, I have had no need to do this as I have set up a litter tray lined with a mixture of fine sand and baking soda, which I periodically empty and refill. In the future, I would probably spray the interior of the lamp housing with compressed air and brush off dead bugs stuck on the metal casing, but other than that, the lamp is extremely low maintenance. I would recommend this product to people who are in my situation: cost effective mosquito control for a private space or room.

I had "won" a similar product at a family reunion and used it for many things. Most recently, I used it to tie my grape vines to supporting stakes. When I ran out, I couldn't find them locally and was so happy to find them available through Amazon.The wire tie makes these strong and the plastic coating makes them good for indoor or outdoor use. So much better than reusing the paper covered ties that come on grocery store products. Highly recommended.
The birds ate all of our blueberries last year, so this year we decided to invest in some netting as a repellent. It is working like a charm. I'm going out to pick the ripe berries tonight.

Bought last summer.  Researching reel mowers, this is the only one I could find that would adjust the cut height.  (Most reel mowers do not adjust AND cut the grass very short, which is bad for each the lawn and the environment-excessive watering required)  I have a small lawn, in town.  50'x60'.  This mower is easy to use/operate (little effort).  Never worry about engine maintenance or having gas or using gas (environment).  Also, of course, it is incredibly quiet.  These mowers do struggle with tall grass or weeds.  If you let the lawn go, it will not cut tall grass.  I enjoy my mower a great deal.  I let the grass get too long on vacation last year and borrowed a gas mower when I returned.  I feel great about the environment and myself every time I use it.

I knew I had a mouse in the basement and wanted to use a humane way to catch it.  I used the trap with just a little peanut butter as some reviewers have advised, and for a couple of weeks absolutely nothing happened (even as the fresh evidence of the mouse continued to mount all around it) to the point that I was ready to dismiss it as ineffective;  then one day I happened to glance at the trap and saw it had "sprung".  No movement from inside, but it felt a bit heavier than it should have if empty, so I steeled myself for the possibility of finding a starved-to-death mouse carcass inside...or having a live mouse jump out at me...okay, actually I had my son open the trap, well away from the house...apparently the mouse was alive and well, and is now living somewhere else.  Happy ending.One minor criticism--it would have been helpful if there had been a way to see inside the trap and know for sure if it contained a mouse, and what the mouse's condition might be.  I don't think I'd have been nervous about opening the trap if I'd had some way of knowing what to expect, and it doesn't seem as though it would be difficult to make a transparent window in the side of the trap for that purpose.
I was a little worried after reading about so many different chain sizes for my Homelite saw. This one fits well and seems to be at least as good as the original.
I have used this brand for a long time now and the Hummingbirds will drain a 2 cup feeder in less than 2 weeks.  They love it!

I actually do not own the current model of the Weber Genesis grill--mine is ten years old and still going strong.  I live in the Pacific Northwest and I use my grill all year around--rain, snow or shine.  I only found out recently that my oven broiler (which was new three years ago) did not work, because I use my grill instead of the oven.  These grills are made to last.  I have never grilled anything that was not done perfectly.  Even  though it is nice to have something new and shiny, I cannot justify replacing my Genesis 4000 as long as it is working.  I started my grilling experience with the Weber kettle grill and would still be using that if I had not received my gas grill for my birthday 10 years ago.  I passed the kettle down to my nephew and he is still using it.  You cannot go wrong with this product. Is is one of the few things manufactured today that is truly of high quality--made to last.
Just what I  expected, it works great and is the perfect size for my husband and myself to use. Thank you
I have always loved Weber and this is no different.Best material for grilling. easy setup,easy cleanup. Cant say enough about this! LOVE it!

I purchased this trap when I was battling groundhogs who saw my garden as a buffet.  I had originally purchased 2 traps from Tractor Supply, but they weren't living up.  The traps were made poorly and the groundhogs were able to pound the cage until the wire came loose and they were able to escape.I did some research and Havahart was getting a high rating.  I purchased this trap and I didn't go wrong.  Nothing is escaping this baby.  It's strong enough to hold the groundhogs and the door is easy to open when you release them.  I will be replacing another Tractor Supply cage this summer with this Havahart.  I highly recommend it.

On the plus side, was fairly easy to put together and doesn't take up too much storage space if you remove the bag/hang it on a wall.  But as other reviewers have said, you have to adjust the height and hold/push the sweeper at just the right angle to get it to pick up.  Once you get the hang of it, though, you're only going to get a small area done at a time before the bag fills up.  In the end, it took just as long to clear an area as it does to use a rake because of all the stopping to empty the bag. I didn't have much luck removing the bag and emptying that way (into a paper lawn bag...), so basically you have to take all the leaves out by hand. Would only recommend if you really can't handle the twisting and turning involved in raking...and have no problem bending and picking up piles of leaves.
They don't work as good as it says...I would not buy this product again...It does not control fleas or other bugs like it says...It is a waste of money...Don't buy this!

I am very happy with this scythe. It cuts easily through most weeds, which is great because that's what I bought it for. It doesn't cut through grass as easily, but that's OK with me, because most of the areas that I need to trim are overgrown weeds. You just have to work a bit harder to cut through tall grasses - in case that's what you are looking to use it for. Using the scythe is good exercise, too - but it's not enough to get you really winded (unless you're kind of out of shape). I actually bought two of these scythes - one to keep in the front yard, and one to keep in the back yard. Turns out that was a good thing, because my (14 year old) son and my (12 year old) nephew (who is visiting us for the summer) had a great time using them to cut back some of the weeds in my back yard. I just made sure they understood that they could NOT work ANYWHERE NEAR EACH OTHER, for safety's sake. It's the first time my son has actually volunteered to help with the yard work. I guess using a garden tool (e.g. a scythe) which also doubles as a weapon on some of his video games was the secret to his interest. Or, to steal a concept from Rita Rudner - "teenage boys will do yardwork, when there's danger involved". Oh, well - whatever their reason, the boys really like using these scythes; and so do I. I highly recommend them for a healthy way to trim your weeds without having to struggle with the nylon fishing line (which always tangles up on me and/or breaks) or electrical cords (that never seem to reach far enough) on one of those electric weed-wackers!
Programmed right out of the box without reading the instructions. Great features and room to expand. Especially like the individual zone watering option.
Arrived in a timely manner.  Quality tool. As advertised.
It's very handy, has a great size when cultivating herbs. So far I have no cons, and the price was good.
Amazing. I am 69, 5'6",  and the 36" version works very well for me, far better than the old splitting maul it replaced. I have been splitting ash with it for a month now, and am very pleased
It's all the good things people say! I could even cut through some gnarly twisted wood that I thought would be impossible!

I've had a number of pulsating sprinklers over the years, and they have always had some plastic parts that just don't hold up.  This one is VERY WELL made and has been used several seasons.  It's just as good as new.  Covers a lot of territory and is easy to adjust.  Recommend it.

Terrible pun I know but this thing is awesome! First test was with steak, sausage and bacon and it was absolutely amazing! I really wasn't expecting the intense smokey flavors that came out of this. It began leaking smoke a bit about half way through the process but a slight tweaking of the lid cut it down to almost nothing. Can't wait to find more things to smoke!!

I've owned the same Patio Caddie for over 10 years now!  It grills beautifully over clay briquettes, giving that great smoke flavor and does it all on a fraction of the propane.  The key to getting lots of heat from a tiny burner is cooking COVERED.  I even bought a kit to retrofit the burner plate and made the old grill like new again for $20!It's a small grill, but will cook six large steaks all at once.
Have used this brand/type before with great success but for some reason the ones I've ordered recently don't attract the flys.
summary: Have used this brand/type before with great success but for some reason the ones I've ordered ...

reviewText: If you are in the market for this type of smoker, do your self a favor and get this one. I owned two different bullet-style water smokers before this one, and neither of them compared. This one keeps the heat in much better, and isn't built as crappy as just about all the other ones. The reason is, this one is one solid cylinder, and all the parts fit nicely together. All the other ones are assembled from one piece of sheet metal, which never fits the top or bottom pieces. Go with the Weber Smokey Mountain.

Bought them with idea for some slip on shoes for garden and saturday generally. they are made of a tough and not very flexible plastic. there is no cushion to them at all. good treads and look ok but very uncomfortable so far. Ive had them 3 days. Ive never had plastic shoes/clogs so i dont know if they break in or what. But if they dont get more comfortable, theyre going in the garbage or to resale. I wish I had bought leather at this point.

I love products that exceed my expectations.  The Avalanche roof rake makes taking show off my roof a pleasure. In fact two of my neighbors came over to see my new toy and they took it home and did their roofs in minutes. I like the fact that the handles can be taken apart for easy storage or I can take it to my cabin.I recommend it to anyone. I'm 68 and it is so easy to use.Great Product!

This shovel is quite heavy, but it deserves 5 stars as even so, its still of such good quality, that it doesn't matter.  Used it several times this year. It was killer on my back when lifting a pile of snow but it gets major props for how much snow it can hold and it even breaks the ice sublayer with that steel edge.  Very happy with it. Now I just need to hit the gym more to strengthen my back muscles. :)

This feeder has allowed me to finally attract hummingbirds to my office window! (I'd tried numerous other models.) It's very nice, heavy-duty quality, which made me a little concerned about how well it would adhere to the window. It has stayed on just fine and refilling the glass cannister is so easy... you just slide the bottle out and back in (no need to disturb the suction cups). I would highly recommend this feeder to others!

I have started a small garden in the hydrofarm.  It was easy to set up.  The pump is a little noisy so you don't want it in a bedroom.  I so far have harvested salad greens.  Now I'm working on trying to grow swiss chard, tomatoes, and green beans.  It is a fun hobby.  I am doing better with this then when I grow plants from seeds in dirt.

I bought this using a gift certificate from work. I  had been looking at metal detectors for a few months and this one quickly rises to the top of the list for entry level and low cost. It's very light weight but reasonably well constructed. There are just enough settings to make it very effective and it's still easy to setup and use. It works very well for shallow to moderately deep targets (1-4 inches) and finds targets well below that when they are larger. The tone setting with disc. set at about 2 o'clock position is very effective for coin shooting. The unit is very sensitive to small targets as deep as 6 inches in the all metal mode. overall I've been very satisfied with this machine and I feel it's the best value for a metal detector in this price range. this one gets my "best bang for the Buck" award.

Though relatively quiet, this mower packs a pretty good wallop. So really, there's no need for more horsepower than 6.5 amps. This machine tore through grass that was about three feet tall without stalling out once. (See the photo of my usual grumpy husband Jeff, who hates mowing the lawn, hogging it all for himself with glee.) This little Black & Decker is light and nimble and just about the best darn lawn mower we ever owned. So there.And what's best, each time you pause, you can just let go of the handle and the mower shuts off. No energy waster, this one, so you'll save on your electric bill big time. Pull on the handle and you're back in business. No tugging on any backbreaking cords till sweat beads on your brow. No sir.And not having to trudge behind a big gas guzzler emitting noxious fumes makes this summer's big splurge almost better than an ice cream cone. Or a snooze on the hammock. Or a cold beer.Okay, maybe not a cold beer. But still.

I previously owned the same lawn mower model. When that mower no longer worked, I researched lawn mowers  and found this model Black and Decker was the best choice. It was packaged in such a way that it was easy for me to assemble.  Delivered in 2 days. Cuts my lawn beautifully!

first off the parts fit loosely together with flimsy snap pins there are no nuts and bolts, I suspect one day the pins holding the bars in place may give way. The biggest problem with this stand however is the fact that its just poorly designed. The description of the hammock stand says it is 5 feet high, but upon measuring the height it is actually less than 4 feet. There is no way you can properly mount a hammock with a stand this low to the ground, I end up having to pull the hammock so tight in order to ovoid hitting my back on the bar beneath me that it makes the hammock very uncomfortable to lay in. Furthermore every body knows you need a good 5 - 6 feet of ground clearance to hang your hammock how do the manufactures of this stand get away with making it less than 4 feet high,do not buy this stand look elsewhere

This grill is awesome!  Cooks fast, easy to use, lightweight (much more so than most modern charcoal grills), and my 85 year old Dad absolutely loves being confident in cooking.  The only thing you have to watch is that the coals get ready faster than anticipate, and the meat really cooks fast!  It even came with a little laminated "cookbook" that has really helped in judging times for cooking.I HIGHLY recommend this grill if you have to have that wonderful charcoal taste and want a simple to operate grill that is easy to move and can be separated to travel if needed.  Wonderful purchase and worth every penny spent just to see my Dad's happy face feeling confident on the grill again!  One more perk ...it shipped really fast!  I am very happy with this purchase.
summary: Purchased to replace similar aluminum grill my Dad has had since Hurricane Betsy in New Orleans!

reviewText: For the price this can not be beat.  Just be extremely careful.  Remember, this does not cost much.  Yes, I would probably purchase it again, just be gentle.

This is an excellent bird feeder.  Not only is it squirrel proof, but it holds enough seed for about 2 weeks.  I have two of these, one for sunflower seeds and the other for songbird seed. It is also easy to fill and can either be hung or pole mounted.

Outstanding grill.*Easy to assemble.*Well made.*Full featured.*Grills like no other grill I have EVER used.*Excellent product support.You will not be dissapointed. My old CharBroil stinks - no comparison.

It doesn't come with a bucket to wrap it around, so no big deal, eh? I've been to SEVEN stores looking for the right sized bucket...they're either too little or too big. The buckets I have looked at:  10 qt., 2 1/2 gallons, 3 gallons, and 5 gallons. All but the 5 gallon bucket are too small, and the 5 gallon bucket makes the belt loop  S_T_R_E_T_C_H to barely meet the velcro attachment . And the hanging hoop lock is positioned right in the middle of nowhere, so it will attach to absolutely nothing, except the handle, which renders the belt loop/velcro enclosure useless.  If you buy this thing, TAKE IT TO THE STORE WITH YOU to find a @$#% BUCKET IT WILL FIT! !!
summary: Send this one back to R&D...

reviewText: Plastair SpringJet 50-Foot Coiled Water Hose and Wand Set, Ocean Blue #PUJ250B93OTThe picture clearly shows brass or metal faucet connectors on the product, but what I received has not just plastic, but cheap plastic connectors. The plastic connector flexes when tighened on the faucet and leaks immensely. When tighened more, it leaks more because it flexes and separates from the internal hose component.  Even if you can tolerate the leaking, if you tug any at all on the hose it will pull through the cheap plastic connector on the faucet separating it from the connector and the faucet.  Unless one is interested in wasting huge amounts of water, I cannot recommend this product to anyone as it is totally unusable.

I read the reviews of this electric mower prior to purchase.  Several reviews stated that the life of the battery after charging was insufficient.  I wish I had payed more attention to this and followed up on it prior to purchase.  My battery life is 35 - 45 minutes and it takes several hours to recharge the battery.  Therefore, cutting my yard winds up taking at least all day with all of this charging figured into it.  My yard is only about 1/2 acre but I have to recharge the battery twice with cutting the yard.Very frustrating!Mary

I like the product, the sensor works well the minute it comes in contact with a subject that crosses its path (that would be me for now) but it's hard for me to tell if I am getting results.  I live in a wooded area with lots of deer.  They come every day and more so at night, so I haven't seen any action yet.

The motion activated sprinkler sounded like a good idea for keeping the deer out of our flower gardens. We installed two and set our game camera to record the fun. Three days later we checked the camera and found the sprinklers activating time after time with no animal or other triggering event present. Then the major disappointment. We watched a full grown deer walk right past the front of the sprinkler and start grazing on our flowers, again. The scarecrow did nothing. Boxed them back up and returned for a refund.
summary: Ran constantly except when a deer was present

reviewText: Absolutely is the best deterrent for large birds. I wasn't pleased with the stake for to me it was not long enough. making the scarecrow tilt to the sky once it went off a few times. I Built a PVC base for it and now it's the best product ever!!!

I was sceptical about buying this product due to all the negative reviews but it works like just like any other electric weedeater I have used but the bonus is theability to rotate the handle for edging and having the guide  the one thing was true about this unit it did go through a whole sppol of string on the first time I trimmed the yard and we have a small yard but the yard had over grown the sidewalks and driveways for 6 months so it was no easy task for any weedwacker but the automatic line feed worked good  basically it is a great buy for the price  cause if you look a a gas weed eater from honda it is 350$

I bought two of them ! They are great for  grilling veggies !!  I have spent way more on the fancier copper coated one , but in the end they all wind up looking the same!  Good price ,good size, good construction ! I really like mine !

This was a birthday gift to me, but the boyfriend has taken over as the grill-master ever since (a diabolical plan on my part). The grill is super-efficient -- heats up fast, cooks evenly, and doesn't take up too much space on our small balcony. A friend purchased a small metal "smoker" box that you can stuff with mesquite chips to add extra grilling flavor -- awesome! I would recommend this grill to anyone, especially apartment dwellers like us with limited outdoor space.

Well, as I only received this about three weeks ago, and the box says very plainly that it takes 60 to 90 days to actually see what the results vis-a-vis this product and my collection of well-dried leaves and garden waste will be ... so I must defer final judgement at this point. Unaided, it seems to take at least six months to produce anything usable, so any promise of improvement on that is well worth waiting fore. I'll update the review then!

Got this for my mom for clipping small branches and etc. It works great. it cuts branches like butter with no problems at all. I use them all the time in the Spring and Summer. I would highly recommend it.

Not ever doing any cooking before, this thermometer has been a pleasant surprise. It takes all of the guess work out of fixing the perfect steak or pork chop, chicken, fish...etc. Easy to use and easy to see numbers. The only thing bad about it is that it can easily change to a Celcius reading, and if you don't notice this, well, say hello to an over-cooked piece of meat!

Update: 2 years ago I found the splitter had lost 2 quarts of oil. I looked for a leak, and rationed that I probably lost the oil because the ground is uneven and the rudimentary air hole in the oil plug lets oil out if it is pointed down hill.I added oil and worked the summer. At the end of the summer, same story, several quarts low. I added more oil and did not observe any leak while it was running, but did observe oil under the oil tank.This year I let it to my nephew who brought it back to my house and I put it in my garage. Voila, I saw an oil leak. Using a light I found the leak was a 1.5" crack in the tank under the engine. I contacted Troy Bilt and told them what I told you. They will not warranty this work and told me to take it to a certified Troy Bilt repair center who quoted me nearly $800 to repair it.It is unfortunate this company does not support customers any better than this. Had I put this splitter on concrete two years ago, I would have found the leak while still under warranty. Even though I reported the leaking oil occurred during the warranty period, and only found the leak last week, they still won't warranty it. This is sad because Troy Bilt used to be something you could buy with confidence, but apparently not anymore. There are too many reports of inadequate welds and cracking tanks to recommend this splitter to anyone. Certainly the hydraulics still work good, but a leaking tank is just plain a bad idea.PaulWhen I researched log splitters, I settled on Troy-Bilt. I examined three models and chose the 33 ton splitter for its power, design and of course the reputation Troy-Bilt has. It comes with a Honda 8 HP engine, which on other slitters is an expensive upgrade.I read the review about it being shipped in parts. I ordered it and found the instructions to actually being helpful. Very well thought out and engineered, I put it together in about 4.5 hours, from the time I opened the crate to when I split the first log. I recommend this to anyone who is interested in a splitter and Amazon's price is the best on the market. I do recommend you have an assistant in putting it together, although one person can assemble it. Please note you also need 8 gallons of hydraulic fluid, not seven. You have to allow for the hoses, cylinder, and filter.I finally got a chance to use it on some 24-30 inch dried cottonwood logs. Impressive is all I have to say. Cottonwood tears, not splits and the family splitter couldn't touch this stuff. This splitter tore right threw it. When it hit nasty narly wood, the ram slowed down and continued on. The auto return feature also is a nice touch, it retracts while you get another piece. I have no regrets and look forward to taking it out in the spring to split the other 10 - 12 cords of hardwood. Right now there is 3 feet of snow on the ground so this will unfortunately have to wait until spring.
I am pleased with my purchase and recommend it to someone looking to do light garden work or replanting a lawn
summary: Cultivator was easy to assemble worked like it should

reviewText: salt would stick under wheel not good for salt when you spin the salt would lodge under the wheel thanks
This saw sure makes light work of cutting branches off your trees. Best investment, I have ever made.

I use an electric smoker and not only are the chips good, but unlike others (Char-broil mesquite and hickory), they come in small chip size whereas I need to chop the others into smaller bits before they fit the small smoker 'drawer'.  Would recommend and will repurchase once these are all smoked.
summary: Great and in small pieces rather than big chunks

reviewText: all that it was intended to be.  a very good thermometer at a very reasonable price. exactly what was needed for my turkey fryer.

Brussel's DT0117ALW Hawaiian Umbrella Tree in Water Pot Bonsai:  I received it as a gift from my daughter.  It was easy to set up.  The only problem was when I first placed the white stones, I put them in the water area instead of in the drain tray.  The drain tray with the white stones in it allows the water to be slowly absorbed thus protecting and prolonging the life of the tree.  I have had it for a month and it didn't loose any leaves as reported that it might.  I bought a little misting bottle for daily soft mists and monitor the tray's white stones.  If I can't see water in the stones I add a little water.  Love the plant!
summary: Great Living Plant for Small Environment

reviewText: This came packaged quite well, and I did not have any missing parts.  The brackets were on the holder itself, with zip ties and they were easy enough to find.  The instructions were clear as how to hang this properly, and installation time took less than two minutes.It is holding a 10 inch pot of geraniums and it was easy to attach to the fence post.  I would order this again.

I purchased this item several years ago and was disappointed with what I paid for this item. reviewText: After my long lasting Troy-Built push lawn mower died, I decided to buy a new one instead of getting it fixed.  After reading and researching on-line reviews for self-propelled lawn mowers it seemed they started in the price range around $300.  I had never had a self-propelled mower before.  But, the thought that if the wife or kids wanted to volunteer mowing our small yard a self-propelled mower would make it a more enjoyable experience.Several features I was looking for were: (1) Larger rear wheels, (2) Dependable engine, (3) Decent warranty, (4) Variable speed drive.  This mower has all these except the variable speed, which was not a problem for me since a little downward pressure on the handle will make the front wheels lift off and slow it down if needed.  With the larger rear wheels it seems to accomplish this and turning fairly well.  Also, this is the << ONLY >> mower in this price range that has a dependable HONDA engine.  Looking at the reviews of more expensive mowers, the HONDA engines were a major selling point considering their ease of starting and dependability.  Some of the reviewers here at Amazon had indicated they had problems with that engine.  For the price to value features of this mower, I was willing to take a gamble.This last weekend it was delivered to our doorstep. The time it had taken since my old mower had died and it arrived had been a little over two weeks.  The lawn looked like a jungle and I was in a hurry to get it mowed before the neighbors started to complain.  Probably should have taken the time to read the instructions first before I assembled and started it though.To start off, there were only 4 bolt/wing nuts to make up as a previous reviewer had indicated. A mistake I made was not putting them in the correct direction since the grass collection bag interfered with the lower ones until I turned them 180 degrees about.  The instructions probably would have told me this if I had read them.  Also, the oil that came in the bottle was just a tad more than the capacity of the oil reservoir.  DON'T OVERFILL a gas engine.  Luckily, I checked the dip stick and saw that it was a little overfull after dumping the WHOLE bottle in.  I emptied a little oil out until the dipstick showed the correct level and continued the startup process by filling the gas tank.At that point I had to get the manual out to see a picture of which way the gas shut-off valve should be pointed.  Also, the spark plug wire had to be attached to the spark plug.  OK... ready to fire her up.  I turned the throttle to choke and gave a couple of tugs.  Nothing.  Huh, maybe I got a dud like the previous reviewer on Amazon.  A couple of more uneventful tugs and I realize the carburetor was flooded with gas.  So, I took the air filter off to let the carburetor air out.A few minutes passed and I replaced the air filter.  A couple of more tugs proved uneventful.  Wow, I stood back in thought looking at the new lifeless piece of equipment I had put so much hope and anticipation in.  Then it dawned on me, I may have to hold the top lever on the handle back when I was pulling the starting cord.  I turned the throttle to medium, held one hand on the "kill switch" lever on the handle and pulled the cord.  The engine burst to life!  If only I had taken the time to read all the instructions, I probably would have had a more successful startup.Nah, I knew what I was doing?  Besides I had a jungle to mow.  The jungle is gone now and I am very confident in this machine to perform well for me in the future.  I even went out a couple of days later while writing this review to test it to see if it started again.  I turned the throttle to "choke" and with one tug it started again.  Also, I noticed the throttle move on it's own down to a run position instead of the "choke" position after it started.  Very cool.Who knows maybe the wife and kids will use this thing?  If nothing else, they can start it for me.
I will never use lighter fluid again.  I can't believe I haven't heard of this before.  In as little as 7 minutes you are cooking...  I highly recommend this product.

reviewText: I've only had this cover for a week, but it's of the highest quality I've ever seen. Last winter, we had a problem in our garage with mice.  Unfortunately, we didn't know it until a repairman saw a mouse scattering about.  By that time, as we discovered, they'd flocked and nested in pretty well.  We tried traps and even another type of sonic deterrent, but to no avail (when you are dealing with many mice, you can only lay so many traps, and most sonic deterrents don't work so well, apparently).I decided (albeit reluctantly) to try these and ordered two.  My goodness! Seriously--within a week, not a mouse--or evidence of any--to be seen! We left one in the garage (which is built to house 3-cars, so it's certainly not tiny) and the other we placed outside since Virginia Beach is having a considerable problem with mice and "roof rats" in the spring-fall, and I'd noticed a proliferation of rodent drops throughout our patio area. Within a few days, no more droppings at all!  I kid you not.  Honestly, after trying other methods of rodent repellency, I really was not at all expecting such results.I am ordering two more because it's spring again and, after forgetting and leaving the outdoor unit outside in all extended periods of wet and cold weather (not recommended by the manufacturer, obviously) it finally gave out.  It took a year to do so, though!  With these kinds of results, I am considering ordering extras for friends and neighbors who've had the same issues.

There is a big red dial that is crimped into place, and there is a valve right next to it. It is a little difficult to get the hang of and takes some getting used to, in terms of how far to turn it to adjust the temperature accordingly.My largest stock pot is the Bayou Classic 1118 32 quart. The cooking surface is more than large enough to accommodate it.

reviewText: Bought this bag in Oct 2011,but gave it as a Christmas gift. In less than 2 weeks, an end seam came apart ( under the the attachment of the handle). Since the date I bought it was more than 30 days to the time we saw the rip/tear, Amazon said their warranty period had passed. So it looks like we are stuck w/ a damaged product.( I learned that if buying a gift from Amazon to buy it nearer to the time that I will be giving it)Addenum: Amazon has now accepted this as a manufacturer's defect and is replacing the bag.Pleased w/ Amazon but not with the bag quality.

I adore this chair.  For a few years now I have suffered excruciating back pain.  Last summer I had just decided that gardening was out for the following season because it just broke my back leaning over or sitting on the ground (even with a pad) and I would be unable to move for days after being outside and working.  This past year I got proactive (I have a HUGE yard and a garden with tons of unwelcomed visitors).  I read the reviews here and decided on this rocker style chair.  SO HAPPY!Why:  It is insanely comfortable.  It has a nice water, dirt and and clumsy/rough behavior resistant fabric and construction, enough cushion, ergonomic rump molding and tilts plenty far forward, sideways and back (while feeling perfectly safe and stable) to get my garden work done.I did not once feel like I was going to tip or that it was going to fly out from under me.It is incredibly durable and very convenient.  It slid and ground into gravel all spring and summer at least 4 days per week for at least a half day at a session without showing any real wear (even on the bottom plastic).  I shoved weeders,scissors, clippers, hand trowels etc. into the pockets and they are in good condition.  No holes, frays... nothing.  There is also storage on the bottom so there is no need for lots of ups and downs (a bonus for the back).  It is light enough to carry by the handle (fabric in back) by one hand and carry a trash can in the other no problem.I also use it when washing the dog in the tub.I can garden day after day with this thing (with occasional stretches) and feel pretty darn good at the end of the day.Also - I was originally wanting a chair that had wheels.  So glad I did not go that way.  I would have been sinking in the dirt and grass, it would not have survived the gravel and this thing (although I am sure they do not recommend it) can scoot easily while still under you.  Plus you can tilt and lean every which way with this.Love this thing!

I have an odd shaped garden on a slope, with wood fence and deck around it.  I wanted to water the areas but avoid the wood.  I bought 4 of these.  I used two sprinklers for the top 2 tiers, and 2 for the bottom 2 tiers.  I adjusted the length of spray to avoid the wood.  I could only use one set of 2 at a time because of water pressure.  It worked.  I connected the two hose ends to a water faucet switch so I only have to toggle on the hose I want to use.  For each set, one sprinkler is attached to the hose, another is attached from the first sprinkler.  I am getting better watering now and much less on any wood.  The only data I wanted it did not have was how short I could make the spray go; the data was for the maximum only.  I have a lot of overlap but it is OK.  I almost have a good tailor-made watering system for the odd shaped garden; I had been dragging a hose around every day.  Things are much simpler now.  I had tried many different type of sprinklers and found the adjustable area one on the Internet - this one.  I never saw it in the stores where I was looking.  Watering is no longer a pain in the neck.  I am no longer losing plants to lack of water.

Ok, these traps are fantastic but I have watched certain little baby mice (who are not heavy enough to trigger the trap) eat all of the peanut butter and walk away and then come back for seconds like our porch was Hometown Buffet or something.  Well, years ago I came up with the perfect plan to solve that problem.  I purchased some Contrac rodenticide poison pellet bags and a six pack of these Snap-E traps for a decent price on Ebay (I couldn't find the six pack here) and I caught 9 mice in three days.  I opened the pellet bags and mixed a few of them in with the peanut butter and baited the traps with the mixture. So, even when the baby mice fill up on second and third helpings and then walk away happy.....they won't be walking for long.  For people who don't want to get too close when disposing of the remains, just open a wire hanger to the desired length, hook the trap and hold over the trash can/bag and with the free hand squeeze the silver bar and release the mouse.  It is so easy!!  The traps did catch one little guy but only caught its leg and didn't kill him so after much debate on what to do we decided to take him for a ride out to a field and set him free.  Look, I know he probably doesn't "stand" a chance out there and if they would all jump in my car I would gladly give them a ride to any other place but mine but that's not how life works and they need to go.  So, again, these traps work...PERIOD!!  It's not the trap's fault that some mice are light on their feet.
summary: HERE'S A TIP TO GET THEM ALL!!!!

reviewText: So these are the lowest price solar charge regulators available.  If you are more concerned about protecting your battery than actually getting what the solar panel can give you, go for it.  I'll be sending these back in favor of some MPPT controllers.  Originally bought six, and had them in parallel with six 12 volt batteries, which were in turn wired together in series for a 72 volt electric trike with six 100 watt solar panels.  They only seemed to give me about half the charge I was getting from the plug in chargers, and really choked the power available while riding.  Tried to contact the manufacturer, who basically said they were not intended for the use I have put them to.  Oh well.  Have wired in one of the mppt units at 24 volts, with 4 remaining Sunforce units, and already seeing 4 more volts available under load than with the 6 Sunforce units, and only spending about eight bucks more over all.
summary: over-protective, at a significant expense of available solar power being WASTED.

My boyfriend and I live in a small apartment with no outdoor space and we really missed being able to grill. We purchased the Meco 9309W deluxe grill and could not be happier. In a nutshell, it is one of the best purchases I have ever made. The grill is small enough that we can store it in our apartment. It is unobtrusive and fits so easily in a spare corner that you wouldn't even know it was there. When we want to use it we simply put it out on our (very) small porch and can actually grill from inside. (Note: this is not an indoor grill.)Though the grill is electric, it cooks very much like a gas grill. Depending on what you are cooking, flareups and smoke can occur, but they make the food taste even better. Grease drips into the bottom of the grill, where there is a small hole for drainage. However, you need to put something beneath to catch the excess. I wish that the sellers would supply a small cup to catch the drippings, as there is a space for one, but a cup made of aluminum foil works just as well and is easy to clean up.The Meco grill is well made and cooks wonderfully. I use it several times a week (sometimes twice a day on weekends). It has plenty of space, so I can cook enough meat and vegetables for four or more people simultaneously. I have not yet used the rotisserie feature, but based on my experiences thus far I am sure it would produce great tasting food.For such a wonderful grill, the price was very reasonable; also, grilling has not increased our electric bill, so it seems comparable to using the oven/stove. I love the Meco grill and look forward to many more years with it. I would recommend it to anyone who doesn't have much space or who doesn't want to spend a lot of money on a large grill.
summary: Great Grill at a Great Price

I have not yet used this product, so this review is not about the product per se.  However, I just received it and was very surprised to find that a very important feature- the ability to use detergents- is unavailable to the customer as the product is received.  I had to search for product reviews to figure out after I received the item that the key to using detergents is a specialized bottle that did not come with it.  The user guide mentions the use of detergents, but doesn't explain how to use them.  The parts list does show a detergent bottle, which didn't come with the item.  You the customer have to be smart enough to connect the dots and figure out that a specialized detergent bottle is the key to using detergents with the product, and that you didn't get one, and have to find it on your own and pay separately for it.  Amazon fails miserably in not informing the customer of this fact before purchase. Only now do I realize that Amazon provided virtually no information on the product- so its anybody's guess as to what you are actually ordering.  Given the importance of this feature to proper use of this product, it was absolutely incumbent on Amazon to inform the customer that this critical part would not be included in their order, and they would either have to use the product without this critical part, which would seriously cripple the usefulness of the product- or spend time and money finding the part on their own.  Shame on Amazon! This failure will certainly affect my future decisions regarding whether or not to purchase other items from Amazon.  Buyer beware!
